remarks: Any positive annihilator of all the group elements is an upper bound on the group exponent.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2016.)
statement:
gexcl.1 $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
gexcl.2 $e |- E = ( gEx ` G ) $.
gexid.3 $e |- .x. = ( .g ` G ) $.
gexid.4 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gexlem2 $p |- ( ( G e. V /\ N e. NN /\ A. x e. X ( N .x. x ) = .0. ) -> E e. ( 1 ... N ) ) $.
$d .0. x $.
$d .x. x $.
$d E x $.
$d G x $.
$d N x $.
$d V x $.
$d X x $.
